content: Add your post description here.
title: Learning LLMs From Scratch

content: Add a brief introduction or summary of your post here. This section can be used to give readers an overview of what to expect in the post. Learning LLMs From Scratch This post is a work in progress, where I will document my journey of learning about Large Language Models (LLMs) from scratch. The goal is to build a foundational understanding of LLMs, their architecture, and how they can be implemented.
title: Learning LLMs From Scratch

content: Initial Steps Understanding the Basics: Start with the fundamental concepts of machine learning and natural language processing (NLP). Familiarize yourself with key terms and techniques. Reading Research Papers: Begin with seminal papers in the field of LLMs, such as the Transformer paper by Vaswani et al. (2017) and the BERT paper by Devlin et al. (2018). Online Courses: Enroll in online courses that cover deep learning and NLP, focusing on modules that discuss LLMs. Hands-On Practice: Implement simple models using libraries like TensorFlow or PyTorch. Start with basic neural networks and gradually move to more complex architectures. Building a Simple LLM: Attempt to build a simple LLM from scratch using a small dataset. This could involve tokenization, embedding layers, and attention mechanisms.
title: Learning LLMs From Scratch

content: Next Steps
title: Learning LLMs From Scratch

content: Resources Books: “Deep Learning” by Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville “Natural Language Processing with Transformers” by Lewis Tunstall, Leandro von Werra, and Thomas Wolf Online Courses: Coursera’s “Natural Language Processing Specialization” by Deeplearning.ai Fast.ai’s “Practical Deep Learning for Coders” YouTube Channels: Yannic Kilcher’s channel for in-depth explanations of research papers Two Minute Papers for quick summaries of recent advancements in AI GitHub Repositories: Hugging Face’s Transformers library for practical implementations of LLMs OpenAI’s GPT-2 and GPT-3 repositories for understanding large-scale models
title: Learning LLMs From Scratch

content: About Me Hello! I’m Etsub Feleke (እጹብ ፈለቀ), a passionate data scientist and software engineer with a keen interest in machine learning and artificial intelligence. I love exploring new technologies and applying them to solve real-world problems. I have a background in computer science and have worked on various projects ranging from data analysis to building machine learning models. My goal is to leverage data to drive insights and create impactful solutions.
title: About Me

content: My Journey I started my journey in technology at a young age, fascinated by how software could transform ideas into reality. Over the years, I’ve honed my skills in programming, data analysis, and machine learning, constantly seeking to learn and grow.
title: About Me

content: Interests Data Science Machine Learning Artificial Intelligence Software Development Photography Books
